title: Bitcoin vs Ethereum: What’s the difference? - NerdWallet
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum are two popular cryptocurrencies with different features and uses. Bitcoin is a payment method and investment, while Ethereum can support financial software and has lower fees. Bitcoin relies on mining, which uses a lot of energy, while Ethereum uses staking, which is more energy efficient. Both cryptocurrencies have different environmental impacts.

summary:

title: Want to Be a Successful Crypto Investor? Follow This Advice from Ethereum's Co-Founder - Blockonomi
summary:
Want to be a successful crypto investor? Follow these tips from Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin:

1. Diversify your investments across different sectors to mitigate risk.
2. Accumulate enough savings to cover multiple years of expenses for financial safety.
3. Keep most of your portfolio in "boring" assets, not thrill-seeking speculative bets.
4. Don't use more than 2x leverage when trading crypto futures.

Buterin blends traditional wisdom with crypto-specific advice for prudent, balanced investing. By following these tips, you can navigate uncertainty and come out ahead in the crypto markets.

He also alleges that Vitalik controls the market and has blown half of the Ethereum ICO proceeds on betting on the price of BTC, then begging the Chinese government.
